alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a naphthalene moiety, which consists of two fused benzene rings.
alternative_parents.name: Naphthalenes

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds that are made up of carbon and hydrogen atoms only.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic hydrocarbons

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic organic compounds made up only of carbon and hydrogen atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Polycyclic hydrocarbons

alternative_parents.description: Hydrocarbons that contains one or more unsaturated carbon atoms. These compounds contain one or more double, triple, or aromatic bonds.
alternative_parents.name: Unsaturated hydrocarbons

class.description: Polycyclic compounds containing a phenanthrene moiety, which is a tricyclic aromatic compound with three non-linearly fused benzene.
class.name: Phenanthrenes and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as chrysenes. These are compounds containing the polyaromatic chrysene moiety, which consists of a benzene ring fused to a phenanthrene ring system to form Benzo[a]phenanthrene.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing the polyaromatic chrysene moiety, which consists of a benzene ring fused to a phenanthrene ring system to form Benzo[a]phenanthrene.
direct_parent.name: Chrysenes

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing the polyaromatic chrysene moiety, which consists of a benzene ring fused to a phenanthrene ring system to form Benzo[a]phenanthrene.
subclass.name: Chrysenes

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
